page.title: 13WINDY NOOK: NATURE PARK
page.content: The nature park project is a partnership between Gateshead Metropolitan Borough Council and the Conservation Volunteers. It began in August 1981. The project is to make the land suitable for different species of plant and wild life which would not normally be seen in an urban area. It is a good idea because the land used to be{derelict}and quite untidy. Also it means that local schools can help to plant trees and look after the pond. Many children in the Felling and Gateshead area can say they have planted at least one tree in the park. The Nature Park covers about 2 hectares, and is on land which used to have houses built on it. Many of the people who lived on this site would have worked in the quarry or pit which were only a short distance away.
